<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 123, 637, 146]]<|/det|> # Cambridge International AS & A Level <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 170, 195, 185]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NAME <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 220, 163, 235]]<|/det|> CENTRE NUMBER <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 213, 424, 260]]<|/det|>
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[724, 220, 722, 235]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[867, 220, 905, 235]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[869, 220, 905, 235]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 277, 231, 292]]<|/det|> MATHEMATICS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 302, 311, 317]]<|/det|> Paper 3 Pure Mathematics 3 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[759, 302, 905, 317]]<|/det|> May/June 2025 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[757, 326, 905, 341]]<|/det|> 1 hour 50 minutes <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 371]]<|/det|> You must answer on the question paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 391, 400]]<|/det|> You will need: List of formulae (MF19) <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 225, 432]]<|/det|> ## INSTRUCTIONS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 291, 450]]<|/det|> - Answer all questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 449, 761, 467]]<|/det|> - Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 482]]<|/det|> - Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 480, 565, 497]]<|/det|> - Write your answer to each question in the space provided. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 497, 482, 512]]<|/det|> - Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 511, 361, 528]]<|/det|> - Do not write on any bar codes. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 526, 867, 544]]<|/det|> - If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 482, 575]]<|/det|> - You should use a calculator where appropriate. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 881, 591]]<|/det|> - You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 605, 854, 621]]<|/det|> - Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question. <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 669, 214, 680]]<|/det|> ## INFORMATION <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 683, 388, 698]]<|/det|> - The total mark for this paper is 75 . <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 730, 715]]<|/det|> - The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 416, 97]]<|/det|>
1 (a) Sketch the graph of \(y=|2 x-3|\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 507, 457, 528]]<|/det|>
(b) Solve the inequality \(3 x-1<|2 x-3|\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 507, 98]]<|/det|>
2 It is given that \(2 \ln p+\ln (p-1)-\frac{1}{2} \ln (q+1)=3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 109, 280, 126]]<|/det|>
Find \(q\) in terms of \(p\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 918, 105]]<|/det|>
3 Find the complex numbers \(z\) for which \(\frac{z+5 \mathrm{i}}{z-5}\) is real and \(|z|=\sqrt{17}\) ．Give your answers in the form \(z=x+\mathrm{i} y\) ，where \(x\) and \(y\) are real．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 430, 91]]<|/det|>
4 The parametric equations of a curve are

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 101, 594, 122]]<|/det|>
\[
x=\mathrm{e}^{\tan t}, \quad y=3 \tan ^{2} t
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 136, 918, 153]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the tangent to the curve at the point（e，3）．Give your answer in the form \(y=m x+c\) ， where \(m\) and \(c\) are exact．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 910, 97]]<|/det|>
5 The polynomial \(3 x^{3}+p a x^{2}+7 a^{2} x+q a^{3}\) is denoted by \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) ，where \(p, q\) and \(a\) are constants and \(a \neq 0\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 107, 918, 126]]<|/det|>
When \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) is divided by \((x+2 a)\) the remainder is \(-22 a^{3}\) ．When \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) is divided by \((3 x-a)\) the remainder is \(-a^{3}\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 156, 327, 173]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(p\) and \(q\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 537, 101]]<|/det|>
6 It is given that \(z_{1}=3 \mathrm{e}^{\frac{1}{4} \pi \mathrm{i}}, z_{2}=\frac{3}{2} \mathrm{e}^{\frac{1}{6} \pi \mathrm{i}}\) and \(\omega=2 \mathrm{e}^{\frac{1}{2} \pi \mathrm{i}}\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 109, 918, 130]]<|/det|>
（a）State the values of \(\omega z_{1}\) and \(\omega z_{2}\) ．Give your answers in the form \(r \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} \theta}\) ，where \(r>0\) and \(-\pi<\theta \leqslant \pi\) ． 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 312, 921, 331]]<|/det|>
（b）On a sketch of an Argand diagram with origin \(O\) ，show the points \(A, B, C\) and \(D\) representing the complex numbers \(z_{1}, z_{2}, \omega z_{1}\) and \(\omega z_{2}\) respectively．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 696, 611, 717]]<|/det|>
（c）State the geometric effects of multiplying \(z_{1}\) and \(z_{2}\) by \(\omega\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[8, 814, 28, 967]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 918, 105]]<|/det|>
7 (a) Express \(5 \sin \left(x+\frac{1}{6} \pi\right)-4 \cos x\) in the form \(R \sin (x-\alpha)\), where \(R>0\) and \(0<\alpha<\frac{1}{2} \pi\). State the exact value of \(R\) and give the value of \(\alpha\) correct to 3 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 76, 918, 105]]<|/det|>
(b) Hence solve the equation \(5 \sin \left(2 \theta+\frac{1}{6} \pi\right)-4 \cos 2 \theta=\sqrt{7}\) for \(0 \leqslant \theta \leqslant \pi\). Give your answers correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 918, 93]]<|/det|>
8 With respect to the origin \(O\), the points \(A\) and \(B\) have position vectors \(2 \mathbf{i}+4 \mathbf{k}\) and \(5 \mathbf{i}+\mathbf{j}+6 \mathbf{k}\) respectively. The line \(l_{1}\) passes through the points \(A\) and \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 121, 449, 140]]<|/det|>
(a) Find a vector equation for the line \(l_{1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 507, 556, 526]]<|/det|>
The line \(l_{2}\) has equation \(\mathbf{r}=2 \mathbf{i}+\mathbf{j}+5 \mathbf{k}+\mu(\mathbf{i}+2 \mathbf{j}+3 \mathbf{k})\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 538, 443, 557]]<|/det|>
(b) Show that \(l_{1}\) and \(l_{2}\) do not intersect.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 503, 595, 524]]<|/det|>
(c) Find the acute angle between the directions of \(l_{1}\) and \(l_{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 460, 108]]<|/det|>
9 The constant \(a\) is such that \(\int_{1}^{a} 6 x \ln x \mathrm{~d} x=4\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 119, 602, 163]]<|/det|>
（a）Show that \(a=\exp \left(\frac{1}{6}\left(\frac{5}{a^{2}}+3\right)\right)\) ，where \(\exp (x)\) denotes \(\mathrm{e}^{x}\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 74, 554, 91]]<|/det|>
(b) Verify by calculation that \(a\) lies between 2 and 2.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 443, 918, 462]]<|/det|>
(c) Use an iterative formula based on the equation in part (a) to determine \(a\) correct to 2 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 764, 97]]<|/det|>
10 (a) Find the quotient and remainder when \(x^{3}+5 x^{2}-2 x-15\) is divided by \(x^{2}-3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 511, 570, 528]]<|/det|>
(b) The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 546, 598, 587]]<|/det|>
\[
\frac{\mathrm{d} y}{\mathrm{~d} x}=\frac{x^{3}+5 x^{2}-2 x-15}{6 y\left(x^{2}-3\right)} .
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 603, 424, 620]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(y=2\) when \(x=2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 632, 738, 651]]<|/det|>
Solve the differential equation to obtain an expression for \(y^{2}\) in terms of \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 105, 90]]<|/det|>
11

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[365, 91, 631, 205]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 219, 918, 241]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve \(y=\cos x \sqrt{\sin 2 x}\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant \frac{1}{2} \pi\). The curve has a maximum point at \(M\), where \(x=a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 269, 358, 286]]<|/det|>
(a) Find the exact value of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 74, 918, 92]]<|/det|>
(b) The region enclosed between the \(x\)-axis and the curve is rotated through \(2 \pi\) radians about the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 121, 509, 138]]<|/det|>
Find the exact volume of the solid generated.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 74, 567, 91]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 105, 918, 122]]<|/det|>
If you use the following page to complete the answer to any question, the question number must be clearly shown.
